item.title: 餐馆和酒吧称音乐许可成本上升令其不堪重负
item.description:
近年来，表演权组织的数量激增，导致一些场所在支付音乐费用方面举步维艰

。【原文：

The number of performing rights organizations has proliferated in recent years, leaving some venues struggling to pay fees for music

】

item.title: 拥有数十亿赌注的兼并套利投资者期待下一波巨额交易
item.description: 合并套利投资者在其交易策略带来一些上半年的暴利后，终于再次享受到了收益。现在，他们有了新的数十亿赌注，他们需要的只是新一轮的交易浪潮。【原文：Merger arbitrage investors are finally enjoying gains again after their trading strategy resulted in some first-half windfalls. Now, with fresh billions to wager, all they need is a new wave of dealmaking.】

item.title: 三星最新可折叠产品在苹果亮相前瞄准主流市场
item.description: 三星电子公司推出了三款新的可折叠智能手机，力图在苹果公司明年推出首款可折叠手机之前巩固其在该领域的领先地位，并扩大主流市场的吸引力。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. introduced three new foldable smartphones in an effort to cement its grip on the category and broaden mainstream appeal before Apple Inc. debuts its first version next year.】

item.description:
Cyberstarts正在推出一项基金，旨在为投资组合公司提供留住人才的优势

。【原文：

Cyberstarts is launching a fund designed to give portfolio companies an edge in retaining talent

】

item.title: 三星发布重新设计的内置谷歌人工智能的智能手表
item.description: 三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co.）升级了其智能手表产品线，这是该公司在苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. upgraded its line of smartwatches, its latest attempt to stand out in a crowded consumer electronics category dominated by Apple Inc.】

item.title: 特朗普税收法案中的税率维持现状是公司的一大胜利
item.description: 美国最大企业的高管们看着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）签署了一项大规模减税法案，而他们自己公司的税率却没有任何变化— 他们为自己的好运气感到庆幸。【原文：Executives at America’s largest corporations watched Donald Trump sign a massive tax-cut bill without any change in their own companies’ tax rates — and were grateful for their good luck.】

item.title: Hims & Hers 股价因计划明年进军加拿大而上涨
item.description: Hims & Hers Health Inc.股价上涨，因为这家远程医疗公司宣布计划明年将业务扩展到加拿大，同时预计仿制药 semaglutide 将上市。【原文：Hims & Hers Health Inc. shares rose after the telehealth company announced plans to expand into Canada next year, timed with the anticipated availability of generic semaglutide.】

item.title: 英伟达价值达 4 万亿美元，涨势再创里程碑
item.description: Nvidia 公司成为历史上首家市场估值达到 4 万亿美元的公司，巩固了其在全球金融市场的王者地位。【原文：Nvidia Corp. became the first company in history to achieve a $4 trillion market valuation, cementing its status as a kingpin in the global financial market.】

item.title: 霍尔茨曼告诉 MNI：欧洲央行无需进一步降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员罗伯特-霍尔兹曼（Robert Holzmann）认为，欧洲中央银行不需要继续实施宽松政策，因为借贷成本可能已经为经济提供了刺激。【原文：The European Central Bank doesn’t need to continue easing policy as borrowing costs may already be providing stimulus to the economy, according to Governing Council member Robert Holzmann.】

item.title: 交易员筛选关税消息，关注美联储会议纪要，美国股市攀升
item.description: 美国股市周三高开，交易员们继续评估源源不断的关税消息，并等待美联储当天晚些时候公布的会议纪要中的任何新细节。【原文：US equities opened higher Wednesday as traders continue to assess the constant stream of tariff news and wait for any fresh detail from the Federal Reserve’s meeting minutes due later in the day.】

item.title: 英国央行就合规问题对万事达卡旗下 Vocalink 公司罚款 1,190 万英镑
item.description: 由于万事达卡公司的 Vocalink 网络未能妥善处理一系列合规方面的失误，英格兰银行对其处以 1190 万英镑（1620 万美元）的罚款，这是央行首次对金融市场基础设施公司处以罚款。【原文：The Bank of England fined Mastercard Inc.’s Vocalink network £11.9 million ($16.2 million) after it failed to properly address a series of compliance lapses, the first time the central bank has imposed monetary penalties on a financial market infrastructure firm.】

item.title: 科威特石油巨头称欧佩克+供应增加表明市场趋紧
item.description: 科威特国家能源公司表示，欧佩克+最近的超大规模供应增长以及最近与客户的互动表明，在夏季驾车季节之后，需求仍将持续增长。【原文：Kuwait’s state energy company said OPEC+’s latest super-sized supply hike and recent interactions with customers suggest persistent demand growth beyond the summer driving season.】

item.title: 前 Citadel Quants 为固定收益金融科技公司融资 3600 万美元
item.description: 由前 Citadel Securities 量化交易员和研究员创立的金融技术公司 Moment 在新一轮融资中筹集了 3600 万美元，投资方包括 Index Ventures 和 Andreessen Horowitz 等公司，以进一步实现固定收益交易技术的自动化。【原文：Moment, a financial-technology company founded by former Citadel Securities quantitative traders and researchers, raised $36 million in a new round of funding from firms including Index Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz to further automate fixed-income trading technology.】

item.title: 可可粉短缺，巧克力制造商再次陷入困境
item.description: 巧克力生产商已经在为创纪录的可可脂价格而苦苦挣扎，可可脂提供了入口即化的感觉。现在，他们还要为赋予产品色泽和口感的可可粉支付更高的价格。【原文：Chocolate makers were already grappling with record prices for cocoa butter, which provides that melt-in-your-mouth feel. Now they are also paying up for the powder that lends their product its color and taste.】

item.title: 打赢特朗普关税之窗关闭，铜价挤压加剧
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划很快对铜征收 50%的关税，这使得从美国铜价飙升中获利的机会越来越少，铜供应紧张的局面即将戛然而止。【原文：An acute copper supply squeeze is coming to an abrupt end as President Donald Trump’s plan to soon slap a 50% tariff on the metal narrows the window to profit from surging US prices.】

item.title: 首只杠杆式 CLO ETF 测试散户的风险偏好
item.description: Reckoner 资本管理公司正在利用交易所交易基金测试投资者对新型高风险赌注的渴望程度，该基金利用杠杆作用提高抵押贷款债务的回报率。【原文：Reckoner Capital Management is testing investors’ hunger for a new category of risky bets with an exchange-traded fund that uses leverage to juice returns on collateralized loan obligations.】

item.title: 阿达尼单位与 MUFG 就 2.5 亿美元离岸贷款进行谈判
item.description: 随着印度企业集团阿达尼集团（Adani Group）寻求为旗下各业务单元筹集资金，投资者对向该公司提供贷款越来越有信心。【原文：Investors are growing more confident lending to Indian conglomerate Adani Group as the company seeks to raise funds for units across the spectrum of its businesses.】

item.title: 特朗普的金砖国家对印度的警告为贸易协定增添了新的转折点
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要因印度参加金砖国家论坛而对其征收新的关税，这使新德里在争取与美国敲定有利的贸易协议时处于艰难境地。【原文：President Donald Trump’s threat to impose new tariffs on India over its participation in the BRICS forum puts New Delhi in a tough position as it races to finalize a favorable trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 日本电信巨头 NTT 启动双币债券销售
item.description: 日本电信巨头 NTT 公司将于周三出售 11 批美元和欧元债券，以帮助为其数据中心业务私有化所使用的过桥贷款再融资。【原文：NTT Inc., the Japanese telecom giant, is selling 11 tranches of bonds on Wednesday in dollars and euros to help refinance bridge loans it used to take its data-center business private.】

item.title: 墨西哥 6 月通胀放缓，墨西哥银行考虑小幅减税
item.description: 随着墨西哥央行对当前宽松周期的步伐进行评估，墨西哥 6 月份的通胀放缓幅度略低于预期。【原文：Mexico inflation slowed marginally less than expected in June, as the central bank evaluates the pace of its current easing cycle.】

item.title: 纳格尔称，欧洲央行既不应计划也不应排除进一步削减的可能性
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，鉴于经济不确定性的加剧，欧洲中央银行必须保持所有选择的开放性，既不应承诺也不应排除再次降息的可能性。【原文：The European Central Bank must keep all its options open, given elevated economic uncertainty, and should neither promise nor exclude another cut in interest rates, according to Governing Council member Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 土耳其抨击马斯克的 "X "计划亵渎神明，这是对 "Grok "计划的最新挑战
item.description: 土耳其政府一位部长表示，埃隆-马斯克的 X 上的人工智能聊天机器人 Grok 生成的亵渎性帖子是不可接受的，可能导致土耳其禁止使用该平台。【原文：Profane posts generated by the Grok artificial intelligence chatbot on Elon Musk’s X are unacceptable and could lead to a ban on the platform in Turkey, according to a government minister.】

item.title: 私募股权投资公司追捧 Astorg 旗下 50 亿欧元基金服务公司 IQ-EQ
item.description: 熟悉此事的人士称，包括 Blackstone Inc. 和 Permira 在内的私募股权公司正在考虑竞购基金服务企业 IQ-EQ，这为今年欧洲竞争最激烈的拍卖之一铺平了道路。【原文：Private equity firms including Blackstone Inc. and Permira are considering bids for fund services business IQ-EQ, people familiar with the matter said, paving the way for one of the most competitive auctions in Europe this year.】

item.title: 阿联酋铝业制造商 EGA 称几内亚终止了该部门的运营协议
item.description: 阿联酋全球铝业股份公司（Emirates Global Aluminium PJSC）称，几内亚政府 "错误地 "终止了允许该公司在这个西非国家开展业务的协议。【原文：Emirates Global Aluminium PJSC said the government of Guinea “wrongfully” terminated the agreement that allows the operations of the company’s unit in the west African country.】

item.title: Zeekr 在中国推出首款混合动力车，帮助缓解电动汽车续航里程焦虑症
item.description: 高级电动汽车品牌 Zeekr 推出了其首款插电式混合动力运动型多用途车，加入了越来越多的中国电动汽车制造商在新车型中加入汽油发动机的行列，以帮助缓解续航里程焦虑。【原文：Premium electric vehicle brand Zeekr unveiled its first plug-in hybrid sport utility vehicle, joining the growing number of Chinese EV makers incorporating gasoline engines into new models to help ease range anxiety.】

item.title: 奥本海默称微软当前股价未反映人工智能的上涨空间

item.description:
在经历了去年的酷暑之后，天气转好对数百万人来说是个好消息，但对电力行业来说却并非如此。【原文：

item.title: 彭特沃特的对冲基金因押注美国钢铁公司十亿美元而暴涨 21
item.description: Pentwater Capital Management 旗下押注企业事件的对冲基金在 6 月份扩大了涨幅，取得了有史以来最好的 6 个月回报，这得益于对美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp.【原文：Pentwater Capital Management’s hedge funds that wager on corporate events extended gains in June to deliver some of their best-ever six-month returns, helped by a mega bet on United States Steel Corp.’s tie-up with Nippon Steel Corp.】

item.title: 波兰放弃煤炭剥离计划，希望为公用事业提供新支持
item.description: 波兰正在取消将无利可图的煤炭资产从国有控股的公用事业公司中分割出去的计划，转而寻求引入新的支持措施，以保持国家电力系统的稳定。【原文：Poland is scrapping plans to carve out unprofitable coal assets from state-controlled utilities and instead seeks to introduce new support measures to keep the country’s electricity system stable.】
